summary: This FBI 302 form documents an interview conducted on August 10, 2019, with a BOP nurse/medic regarding the response to Jeffrey Epstein's death in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The nurse describes arriving at the cell, finding Epstein unresponsive with a ligature around his neck, and the subsequent unsuccessful resuscitation efforts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the medical emergency and death in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). Found unresponsive with a ligature around his neck.

connections.description: L, a BOP nurse/medic, was the medical professional who responded to the emergency call for Epstein and attempted life-saving measures.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) with a ligature around his neck. Medical personnel, including BOP nurse/medic L, responded and attempted resuscitation, which was unsuccessful.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Nurse
events.description: An FBI investigator interviewed BOP nurse/medic L regarding the response to Jeffrey Epstein's death in his cell. The interview took place on the 9th floor outside of the 'L' tier.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 0633 hours on August 10, 2019.
BOP nurse/medic L arrived at the cell at 0635 hours and observed Epstein with no pulse and no signs of life, with a ligature still around his neck.
Resuscitation efforts, including CPR, intubation, oxygen, epinephrine, and attempted use of an AED, were unsuccessful.
The document is an FBI 302 form recording an interview with a first responder, indicating the early stages of the investigation into Epstein's death.
